notes: Mascarpone was impossibly light — almost mousse-like. Ladyfingers soaked perfectly, not soggy. Cocoa had a slight bitterness that balanced the sweetness. One of the best I've had.
Presentation was beautiful. Flavor solid but the espresso soak was a touch weak — wanted more coffee punch. Cream layer was rich, maybe too sweet. Good, not transcendent.
Classic execution done right. Espresso was bold, ladyfingers had just the right give. Cocoa dusting was generous. Lost a point for slightly grainy mascarpone texture.
